insuredreferringprovider.description: The referring provider that is associated with the insurance.

ircname.description: Insurance category / company. E.g., United Healthcare, BCBS-MA, etc.

lastupdated.description: Date on which patient record was last updated.

lastupdatedby.description: User who last updated the patient record.

packageexpirationdate.description: BETA FIELD: Expiration date of insurance package.

paymentplanid.description: BETA FIELD: The payment plan id associated with patient's insurance.

pendinginsurancepackageid.description: BETA FIELD: The insurance package id of pending insurance package.

policynumber.description: The insurance group number.  This is sometimes present on an insurance card.

relatedtoautoaccidentyn.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Boolean field indicating whether this case policy is related to an auto accident.

relatedtoemploymentyn.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Boolean field indicating whether this case policy is related to the patient's employer.

relatedtootheraccidentyn.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Boolean field indicating whether this case policy is related to another accident.  Only available for worker's comp case policies.

relationshiptoinsured.description: This patient's relationship to the policy holder (text).

relationshiptoinsuredid.description: This patient's relationship to the policy holder (as an ID). See the mapping.

repricername.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Name for the repricer.  Only available for worker's comp case policies.

repricerphone.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Phone number for the repricer.  Only available for worker's comp case policies.

sequencenumber.description: 1 = primary, 2 = secondary, 3 = tertiary, etc.  Must have a primary before a secondary and a secondary before a tertiary, etc.

slidingfeeplanid.description: If the patient is on a sliding fee plan, this is the ID of that plan.  See /slidingfeeplans.

stateofreportedinjury.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Two-letter state abbreviation for the state this injury was reported in.  Only available for worker's comp case policies.

language6392code.description: Language of the patient, using the ISO 639.2 code. (http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php; "T" or terminology code) Special case: use "declined" to indicate that the patient declined to answer.

lastappointment.description: The last appointment for this patient (before today), excluding cancelled or no-show appointments. (mm/dd/yyyy h24:mi)

lastemail.description: The last email for this patient on file.

lastupdated.description: Date on which patient record was last updated.

lastupdatedby.description: User who last updated the patient record.

localpatientid.description: 'Given showlocalpatientid is true, comma separated local patient id will be returned, if patient id is enterprise id else given patient id will be displayed.'

maritalstatus.description: Marital Status (D=Divorced, M=Married, S=Single, U=Unknown, W=Widowed, X=Separated, P=Partner)

maritalstatusname.description: The long version of the marital status.

medicationhistoryconsentverified.description: Medication history consent status.  If a practice doesn't have RXHub or Surescripts enabled, this will be null

mobilecarrierid.description: The ID of the mobile carrier, from /mobilecarriers or the list below.

mobilephone.description: The patient's mobile phone number. On input, 'declined' can be used to indicate no number. (Alternatively, hasmobile can also be set to false. "declined" simply does this for you.)  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

nextkinname.description: The full name of the next of kin.

nextkinphone.description: The next of kin phone number.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

nextkinrelationship.description: The next of kin relationship (one of SPOUSE, PARENT, CHILD, SIBLING, FRIEND, COUSIN, GUARDIAN, OTHER)

occupationcode.description: Occupation of the patient, using the US Census occupation code (code system 2.16.840.1.113883.6.240).  "other" can be used as well.

onlinestatementonlyyn.description: Set to true if a patient wishes to get e-statements instead of paper statements. Should only be set for patients with an email address and clients with athenaCommunicator. The language we use in the portal is, "Future billing statements will be sent to you securely via your Patient Portal account. You will receive an email notice when new statements are available." This language is not required, but it is given as a suggestion.

patientid.description: Please remember to never disclose this ID to patients since it may result in inadvertant disclosure that a patient exists in a practice already.

patientphotourl.description: The URL to the patient photo

patientphotoyn.description: True if the patient has a photo uploaded

portalaccessgiven.description: This flag is set if the patient has been given access to the portal. This may be set by the API user if a patient has been given access to the portal "by providing a preprinted brochure or flyer showing the URL where patients can access their Patient Care Summaries." The practiceinfo endpoint can provide the portal URL. While technically allowed, it would be very unusual to set this to false via the API.

portalsignatureonfile.description: This flag is set if the patient's signature is on file

portalstatus.description: Portal status details.  See /patients/{patientid}/portalstatus for details.

blockedfailedloginsyn.description: Is this patient blocked from the portal due to failed login attempts.

familyblockedfailedloginsyn.description: Is this patient's family blocked from the portal due to failed login attempts.

familyregisteredyn.description: Is there a family member registered with access to this patient.

lastloginentity.description: Either "PATIENT" or "FAMILY", the last entity who accessed this patient.

noportalyn.description: The privacy setting for blocking the patient from the portal is set.

portalregistrationdate.description: The date the patient registered for the portal.

registeredyn.description: If this patient is registered or not for the portal.

status.description:
The status of the patient.  Possible statuses:
				 <li>REGISTERED: The patient is registered for the portal.
				 <li>NOTREGISTERED: The patient is not registered for the portal.
				 <li>FAMILYLOGIN: This patient is set up for a family member to login.
				 <li>NOPORTAL: The privacy setting for blocking the patient from the portal is set.
				 <li>BLOCKEDFAILEDLOGINS: The patient is blocked because of failed login attempts.
				 <li>FAMILYBLOCKEDFAILEDLOGINS: The family member is blocked because of failed login attempts.

termsaccepted.description: Has this patient accepted the portal's Terms and Conditions.  This is a good indicator if the patient has actually logged in to the portal or simply is registered without ever having logged in.

portaltermsonfile.description: Flag determining whether or not the patient has accepted the Terms and Conditions for the patient portal.

povertylevelcalculated.description: Patient's poverty level (% of the Federal Poverty Level), as calculated from family size, income per pay period, pay period, and state. Typically only valued if client has Federal Poverty Level fields turned on.

povertylevelfamilysize.description: Patient's family size (used for determining poverty level). Only settable if client has Federal Poverty Level fields turned on.

povertylevelfamilysizedeclined.description: Indicates if the patient delcines to provide "povertylevelfamilysize". Should be set to Yes if the patient declines.

povertylevelincomedeclined.description: Indicates if the patient delcines to provide "povertylevelincomeperpayperiod". Should be set to Yes if the patient declines.

povertylevelincomepayperiod.description: Patient's pay period (used for determining poverty level). Only settable if client has Federal Poverty Level fields turned on.

povertylevelincomeperpayperiod.description: Patient's income per specified pay period (used for determining poverty level). Only settable if client has Federal Poverty Level fields turned on.

povertylevelincomerangedeclined.description: Indicates if the patient declines to provide an income range level. True if the patient declines.

previouspatientids.description: The IDs of the patient this one was merged from.

primarydepartmentid.description: The patient's "current" department. This field is not always set by the practice.

primaryproviderid.description: The "primary" provider for this patient, if set.

privacyinformationverified.description: This flag is set if the patient's privacy information has been verified. Privacy information returns True if all of the items referenced in GET /patients/{patientid}/privacyinformationverified are true. Privacy information returns false if any of the items referenced in the GET /patients/{patientid}/privacyinformationverified API are false or expired.

publichousing.description: Used to identify this patient as living in public housing. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

race.description: The patient race, using the 2.16.840.1.113883.5.104 codeset. See http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/terminologies-v3.html Special case: use "declined" to indicate that the patient declined to answer. Multiple values or a tab-seperated list of codes is acceptable for multiple races for input.  The first race will be considered "primary".  Note: you must update all values at once if you update any.

racecode.description:
The patient race hierarchical code as specified in Race & Ethnicity - CDC
   * (2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.14914)

racename.description: The patient's primary race name.  See race for more complete details.

referralsourceid.description: The referral / "how did you hear about us" ID.

referralsourceother.description: If choosing "other" for referral source, this is the text field that can be filled out.

schoolbasedhealthcenter.description: Used to identify this patient as school-based health center patient. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

score.description: This is the patient's matching score.  This indicates how likely this patient is to be the patient you are searching for given the demographics input.  A score of 26 indicates the patient is automatically assumed to be the same.  A score under 16 indicates that this is almost guaranteed to NOT be the patient you are looking for (we will never return any patient with a score under 16).  A score of around 23 is the maximum you can get if the only parameters you pass in are the required parameters.

sexualorientationother.description: If a patient does not identify with any prescribed sexual orientation choice, this field stores the patient-provided description of sexual orientation.

smsoptindate.description: The date on which the patient's consent to receive text messages as per FCC requirements was recorded. In order for this to be valid, a valid mobile phone number must be set and the practice setting 'Hide SMS Opt-in option' must be set to Off.

status.description: The "status" of the patient, one of active, inactive, prospective, or deleted.

veteran.description: Used to identify this patient as a veteran. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

workphone.description: The patient's work phone number.  Generally not used to contact a patient.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

zip.description: Patient's zip.  Matching occurs on first 5 characters.

get.summary: Get list of patients - matching custom-field criteria
get.description: Retrieves matching patients based on custom field value. The customfieldvalue is either an actual value for non-select fields or an optionid when the value was from select field.

parameters.name: customfieldid
parameters.description: customfieldid

parameters.name: practiceid
parameters.description: practiceid

parameters.name: customfieldvalue
parameters.description: customfieldvalue

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of entries to return (default 10, max 100)Please note that this endpoint has a different default and max than normal.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting point of entries; 0-indexed

agriculturalworker.description: Used to identify this patient as an agricultural worker. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

agriculturalworkertype.description: For patients that are agricultural workers, identifies the type of worker. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

balances.description: List of balances owed by the patient, broken down by provider (financial) group.

cleanbalance.description: Indicates whether the balance is associated with a contract, payment plan, or collections agency.

collectionsbalance.description: The outstanding amount associated with a collections agency.

contracts.description: Active credit card contracts directly linked to claims with outstanding patient balances.

availablebalance.description: The available balance on this contract.

contractclass.description: The type of contract.  For example, "ONEYEAR,"

maxamount.description: The maximum allowed amount for this contract.

departmentids.description: Comma separated list of department IDs that belong to this group

paymentplanbalance.description: The outstanding amount associated with a payment plan.

providergroupid.description: Athena ID for this financial group.

caresummarydeliverypreference.description: The patient's preference for care summary delivery.

claimbalancedetails.description: Claim level details on patient balances.  (This is only included when SHOWBALANCEDETAILS is set.)

confidentialitycode.description: Gives the confidentiality code for the patient. Only returned when IGNORERESTRICTIONS is set to true, or the CLTH_DP_NEW_BTG_MDP_RESTRICTIONS toggle is enabled.

consenttocall.description: The flag is used to record the consent of a patient to receive automated calls per FCC requirements. The requested legal language is 'Entry of any telephone contact number constitutes written consent to receive any automated, prerecorded, and artificial voice telephone calls initiated by the Practice. To alter or revoke this consent, visit the Patient Portal "Contact Preferences" page.'

consenttotext.description: The flag is used to record the consent of a patient to receive text messages per FCC requirements. In order for this to be true, a valid mobile phone number must be set and the practice setting "Hide SMS Opt-in option" must be set to Off.

contacthomephone.description: Emergency contact home phone.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

contactmobilephone.description: Emergency contact mobile phone.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

contactname.description: The name of the (emergency) person to contact about the patient. The contactname, contactrelationship, contacthomephone, and contactmobilephone fields are all related to the emergency contact for the patient. They are NOT related to the contractpreference_* fields.

contactpreference.description: The MU-required field for "preferred contact method". This is not used by any automated systems.

contactpreference_announcement_email.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "announcement" communications delivered via email.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For completeness, turning email off is supported via the API, but it is discouraged. When email is off, patients may not not get messages from the patient portal.

contactpreference_announcement_phone.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "announcement" communications delivered via phone.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.

contactpreference_announcement_sms.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "announcement" communications delivered via SMS.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For SMS, there is specific terms of service language that must be used when displaying this as an option to be turned on.  Turning on must be an action by the patient, not a practice user.

contactpreference_appointment_email.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "appointment" communications delivered via email.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For completeness, turning email off is supported via the API, but it is discouraged. When email is off, patients may not not get messages from the patient portal.

contactpreference_appointment_phone.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "appointment" communications delivered via phone.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.

contactpreference_appointment_sms.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "appointment" communications delivered via SMS.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For SMS, there is specific terms of service language that must be used when displaying this as an option to be turned on.  Turning on must be an action by the patient, not a practice user.

contactpreference_billing_email.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "billing" communications delivered via email.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For completeness, turning email off is supported via the API, but it is discouraged. When email is off, patients may not not get messages from the patient portal.

contactpreference_billing_phone.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "billing" communications delivered via phone.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.

contactpreference_billing_sms.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "billing" communications delivered via SMS.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For SMS, there is specific terms of service language that must be used when displaying this as an option to be turned on.  Turning on must be an action by the patient, not a practice user.

contactpreference_lab_email.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "lab" communications delivered via email.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For completeness, turning email off is supported via the API, but it is discouraged. When email is off, patients may not not get messages from the patient portal.

contactpreference_lab_phone.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "lab" communications delivered via phone.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.

contactpreference_lab_sms.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "lab" communications delivered via SMS.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For SMS, there is specific terms of service language that must be used when displaying this as an option to be turned on.  Turning on must be an action by the patient, not a practice user.

contactrelationship.description: Emergency contact relationship (one of SPOUSE, PARENT, CHILD, SIBLING, FRIEND, COUSIN, GUARDIAN, OTHER)

customfields.description: Same as /patients/{patientid}/customfields call, but without the department ID. Depending on setup, and only in large practices, the custom field values may or may not be the same between departments. If this is a concern, using the /patients/{patientid}/customfields call is preferred. Only for a single patient when showcustomfields is set to true.

customfieldvalue.description: For a non-select custom field, the value.

optionid.description: For a select custom field, the selectid value (from /customfield's selectlist).

referringproviderid.description: For a referring provider custom field, the referring provider's ID.

deceaseddate.description: If present, the date on which a patient died.

defaultpharmacyncpdpid.description: The NCPDP ID of the patient's preferred pharmacy.  See http://www.ncpdp.org/ for details. Note: if updating this field, please make sure to have a CLINICALORDERTYPEGROUPID field as well.

donotcallyn.description: Warning! This patient will not receive any communication from the practice if this field is set to true.

driverslicenseurl.description: The URL to the patient's driver's license

driverslicenseyn.description: True if the patient has a driver's license uploaded

email.description: Patient's email address.  'declined' can be used to indicate just that.

emailexistsyn.description: True if email exists. False if patient declined. Null if status is unknown.

employerphone.description: The patient's employer's phone number. Normally, this is set by setting employerid. However, setting this value can be used to override this on an individual patient.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

ethnicitycode.description: Ethnicity of the patient, using the 2.16.840.1.113883.5.50 codeset. See http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/terminologies-v3.html Special case: use "declined" to indicate that the patient declined to answer.

ethnicitycodes.description: Ethnicity of the patient, using the 2.16.840.1.113883.5.50 codeset. See http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/terminologies-v3.html Special case: use "declined" to indicate that the patient declined to answer. Multiple values or a tab-seperated list of codes is acceptable for multiple ethnicities for input.  The first ethnicity will be considered "primary".  Note: you must update all values at once if you update any.

firstappointment.description: The first appointment for this patient, excluding cancelled or no-show appointments. (mm/dd/yyyy h24:mi)

firstnameused.description: First name the patient uses - may differ from legal first name

guarantoraddresssameaspatient.description: The address of the guarantor is the same as the patient.

guarantorphone.description: Guarantor's phone number.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

guarantorrelationshiptopatient.description: The guarantor's relationship to the patient

guardianfirstname.description: The first name of the patient's guardian.

guardianlastname.description: The last name of the patient's guardian.

guardianmiddlename.description: The middle name of the patient's guardian.

guardiansuffix.description: The suffix of the patient's guardian.

hasmobileyn.description: Set to false if a client has declined a phone number.

homeboundyn.description: If the patient is homebound, this is true.

homeless.description: Used to identify this patient as homeless. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

homelesstype.description: For patients that are homeless, provides more detail regarding the patient's homeless situation. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

homephone.description: The patient's home phone number.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

industrycode.description: Industry of the patient, using the US Census industry code (code system 2.16.840.1.113883.6.310).  "other" can be used as well.

insurances.description: List of active patient insurance packages. Only shown for a single patient and if SHOWINSURANCE is set.

adjusterfax.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Fax for the adjuster on this case policy.  Only available for auto insurance or worker's comp case policies.

adjusterfirstname.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - First name of the adjuster on this case policy.  Only available for auto insurance or worker's comp case policies.

adjusterlastname.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Last name of the adjuster on this case policy.  Only available for auto insurance or worker's comp case policies.

adjusterphone.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Phone number/other contact info for the adjuster on this case policy.  Only available for auto insurance or worker's comp case policies.

anotherpartyresponsibleyn.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Boolean field indicating if another party was responsible for this accident.

autoaccidentstate.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the auto accident took place. Only meaningful for auto insurance case policies.

cancelled.description: The date in which the insurance was marked cancelled.

cancelledby.description: The username of the user who cancelled this insurance in athenanet.

caseinjurydate.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Date of the injury.  Required for auto insurance, legal, and worker's comp case policies.

casepolicytypename.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - The name of this type of case policy.

ccmstatusid.description: Status ID of current CCM enrollment.

ccmstatusname.description: The name of current CCM enrollment status.

coinsurancepercent.description: The coinsurance percentage for this insurance. If you've just POSTed a new insurance you will have to wait for the auto eligbility check before this field populates.

confidentialitycode.description: Gives the confidentiality code for the patient. Only returned when CLTH_DP_NEW_BTG_MDP_RESTRICTIONS toggle is enabled.

copays.description: Details about the copays for this insurance package. If you've just POSTed a new insurance you will have to wait for the auto eligbility check before these populate.

coveragetype.description: Details about the coverage type for this insurance package. This information is available according to the access level from the session user.

created.description: The date in which the insurance was created.

createdby.description: The username of the user who created this insurance in athenanet.

deletednote.description: The athenaNet insurance notes added while cancelling the insurance.

descriptionofinjury.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - A description of the injury.  Only available for auto insurance and worker's comp case policies.

eligibilitylastchecked.description: Date the eligibility was last checked.

eligibilitymessage.description: The message, usually from our engine, of the eligibility check.

eligibilityreason.description: The source of the current status. Athena is our eligibility engine.

eligibilitystatus.description: Current eligibility status of this insurance package.

employerid.description: The employer ID associated with the patient's insurance.

icd10codes.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - See documentation for ICD9CODES.

icd9codes.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - A list of ICD9 accepted diagnosis codes. Only available for worker's comp case policies.

injuredbodypart.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Text field for describing the injured body part.  Only available for auto insurance  and worker's comp case policies.

insuranceclaimnumber.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - The auto insurance claim number or the worker's comp claim number.

insuranceidnumber.description: The insurance policy ID number (as presented on the insurance card itself).

insurancepackageaddress1.description: Address 1 for the AthenaNet insurance Package.

insurancepackageaddress2.description: Address 2 for the AthenaNet insurance Package.

insurancepackagecity.description: City for the AthenaNet insurance Package.

insurancepackagestate.description: State of the AthenaNet insurance package

insurancepackagezip.description: Zip code of the AthenaNet insurance package

insurancepayername.description: Name of the payer specific insurance package.

insurancephone.description: The phone number for the insurance company. Note: This defaults to the insurance package phone number. If this is set, it will override it. Likewise if blanked out, it will go back to default.

insuranceplandisplayname.description: Superpackagename of the specific insurance package.

insuranceplanname.description: Name of the specific insurance package.

insurancepolicyholder.description: The full name of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholderaddress1.description: The first address line of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholderaddress2.description: The second address line of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholdercity.description: The city of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholdercountrycode.description: The country code (3 letter) of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholdercountryiso3166.description: The ISO 3166 country code of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholderdob.description: The DOB of the insurance policy holder (mm/dd/yyyy).

insurancepolicyholderfirstname.description: The first name of the insurance policy holder.  Except for self-pay, required for new policies.

insurancepolicyholderlastname.description: The last name of the insurance policy holder.  Except for self-pay, required for new policies.

insurancepolicyholdermiddlename.description: The middle name of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholdersex.description: The sex of the insurance policy holder.  Except for self-pay, required for new policies.

insurancepolicyholderssn.description: The SSN of the insurance policy holder. If set, it should be either 9 digits or masked 9 chars(* followed by digits).

insurancepolicyholderstate.description: The state of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholdersuffix.description: The suffix of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholderzip.description: The zip of the insurance policy holder.

insurancetype.description: Type of insurance. E.g., Medicare Part B, Group Policy, HMO, etc.

insuredentitytypeid.description: The ID of the entity type for this insurance.

insuredidnumber.description: The insurance policy ID number of insured.

insuredpcpnpi.description: The national provider id of the primary care physcian assicated with the insurance.

insuredreferringprovider.description: The referring provider that is associated with the insurance.

ircname.description: Insurance category / company. E.g., United Healthcare, BCBS-MA, etc.

lastupdated.description: Date on which patient record was last updated.

lastupdatedby.description: User who last updated the patient record.

paymentplanid.description: The payment plan id associated with patient's insurance.

pendinginsurancepackageid.description: The insurance package id of pending insurance package.

policynumber.description: The insurance group number.  This is sometimes present on an insurance card.

relatedtoautoaccidentyn.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Boolean field indicating whether this case policy is related to an auto accident.

relatedtoemploymentyn.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Boolean field indicating whether this case policy is related to the patient's employer.

relatedtootheraccidentyn.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Boolean field indicating whether this case policy is related to another accident.  Only available for worker's comp case policies.

relationshiptoinsured.description: This patient's relationship to the policy holder (text).

relationshiptoinsuredid.description: This patient's relationship to the policy holder (as an ID). See the mapping.

repricername.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Name for the repricer.  Only available for worker's comp case policies.

repricerphone.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Phone number for the repricer.  Only available for worker's comp case policies.

sequencenumber.description: 1 = primary, 2 = secondary, 3 = tertiary, etc.  Must have a primary before a secondary and a secondary before a tertiary, etc.

slidingfeeplanid.description: If the patient is on a sliding fee plan, this is the ID of that plan.  See /slidingfeeplans.

stateofreportedinjury.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Two-letter state abbreviation for the state this injury was reported in.  Only available for worker's comp case policies.

language6392code.description: Language of the patient, using the ISO 639.2 code. (http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php; "T" or terminology code) Special case: use "declined" to indicate that the patient declined to answer.

lastappointment.description: The last appointment for this patient (before today), excluding cancelled or no-show appointments. (mm/dd/yyyy h24:mi)

lastemail.description: Tthe last email for this patient on file.

maritalstatus.description: Marital Status (D=Divorced, M=Married, S=Single, U=Unknown, W=Widowed, X=Separated, P=Partner)

maritalstatusname.description: The long version of the marital status.

medicationhistoryconsentverified.description: Medication history consent status.  If a practice doesn't have RXHub or Surescripts enabled, this will be null

mobilecarrierid.description: The ID of the mobile carrier, from /mobilecarriers or the list below.

mobilephone.description: The patient's mobile phone number. On input, 'declined' can be used to indicate no number. (Alternatively, hasmobile can also be set to false. "declined" simply does this for you.)  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

nextkinname.description: The full name of the next of kin.

nextkinphone.description: The next of kin phone number.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

nextkinrelationship.description: The next of kin relationship (one of SPOUSE, PARENT, CHILD, SIBLING, FRIEND, COUSIN, GUARDIAN, OTHER)

occupationcode.description: Occupation of the patient, using the US Census occupation code (code system 2.16.840.1.113883.6.240).  "other" can be used as well.

onlinestatementonlyyn.description: Set to true if a patient wishes to get e-statements instead of paper statements. Should only be set for patients with an email address and clients with athenaCommunicator. The language we use in the portal is, "Future billing statements will be sent to you securely via your Patient Portal account. You will receive an email notice when new statements are available." This language is not required, but it is given as a suggestion.

patientid.description: Please remember to never disclose this ID to patients since it may result in inadvertant disclosure that a patient exists in a practice already.

patientphotourl.description: The URL to the patient photo

patientphotoyn.description: True if the patient has a photo uploaded

portalaccessgiven.description: This flag is set if the patient has been given access to the portal. This may be set by the API user if a patient has been given access to the portal "by providing a preprinted brochure or flyer showing the URL where patients can access their Patient Care Summaries." The practiceinfo endpoint can provide the portal URL. While technically allowed, it would be very unusual to set this to false via the API.

portalstatus.description: Portal status details.  See /patients/{patientid}/portalstatus for details.

povertylevelcalculated.description: Patient's poverty level (% of the Federal Poverty Level), as calculated from family size, income per pay period, pay period, and state. Typically only valued if client has Federal Poverty Level fields turned on.

povertylevelfamilysize.description: Patient's family size (used for determining poverty level). Only settable if client has Federal Poverty Level fields turned on.

povertylevelfamilysizedeclined.description: Indicates if the patient delcines to provide "povertylevelfamilysize". Should be set to Yes if the patient declines.

povertylevelincomedeclined.description: Indicates if the patient delcines to provide "povertylevelincomeperpayperiod". Should be set to Yes if the patient declines.

povertylevelincomepayperiod.description: Patient's pay period (used for determining poverty level). Only settable if client has Federal Poverty Level fields turned on.

povertylevelincomeperpayperiod.description: Patient's income per specified pay period (used for determining poverty level). Only settable if client has Federal Poverty Level fields turned on.

povertylevelincomerangedeclined.description: Indicates whether or not the patient declines to provide an income level.

primarydepartmentid.description: The patient's "current" department. This field is not always set by the practice.

primaryproviderid.description: The "primary" provider for this patient, if set.

privacyinformationverified.description: This flag is set if the patient's privacy information has been verified. Privacy information returns True if all of the items referenced in GET /patients/{patientid}/privacyinformationverified are true. Privacy information returns false if any of the items referenced in the GET /patients/{patientid}/privacyinformationverified API are false or expired.

publichousing.description: Used to identify this patient as living in public housing. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

race.description: The patient race, using the 2.16.840.1.113883.5.104 codeset.  See http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/terminologies-v3.html Special case: use "declined" to indicate that the patient declined to answer. Multiple values or a tab-seperated list of codes is acceptable for multiple races for input.  The first race will be considered "primary".  Note: you must update all values at once if you update any.

racename.description: The patient's primary race name.  See race for more complete details.

referralsourceid.description: The referral / "how did you hear about us" ID.

schoolbasedhealthcenter.description: Used to identify this patient as school-based health center patient. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

status.description: The "status" of the patient, one of active, inactive, prospective, or deleted.

veteran.description: Used to identify this patient as a veteran. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

workphone.description: The patient's work phone number.  Generally not used to contact a patient.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

zip.description: Patient's zip.  Matching occurs on first 5 characters.

get.summary: Get list of patients - (optional) visible to a practitioner
get.description: Retrieves patients in a practice based on their partial name or full patient id Note: This endpoint may rely on specific settings to be enabled in athenaNet Production to function properly that are not required in other environments. Please see Permissioned Rollout of APIs for more information if you are experiencing issues.

parameters.name: practiceid
parameters.description: practiceid

parameters.name: athenanetuser
parameters.description: Username to check permissions against, required for restricted patients

parameters.name: searchtype
parameters.description: The search type to search by. The types can be retrieved in /configuration/patients/searchtypes

parameters.name: maxresults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return (default 50)

parameters.name: searchterm
parameters.description: The search term for finding patients, partial name or full patient id

parameters.name: confidentialitycode
parameters.description: A comma separated list of confidentiality codes to filter patients by. If not set defaults to include all confidentiality codes. Supported codes: 'N' and 'R'. Only functions if the CLTH_DP_NEW_BTG_MDP_RESTRICTIONS toggle is enabled.

confidentialitycode.description: Gives the confidentiality code for the patient. Only returned when CLTH_DP_NEW_BTG_MDP_RESTRICTIONS toggle is enabled.

patients.description: List of patients matching the search criteria

get.summary: Get reference list of patient's gender identity information
get.description: BETA: Retrieves a list of gender identities configured for the practice

parameters.name: practiceid
parameters.description: practiceid

parameters.name: show2015edcehrtvalues
parameters.description: If passed, will return the 2015 Ed. CEHRT values for describing gender identity for a patient that should be used with the genderidentity argument to POST /patients and PUT /patients/{patientid}. Otherwise, will return a list of strings that can be used with the genderidentity argument to POST /patients and PUT /patients/{patientid} for those clients that are using the 'Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation Workflows (Transgender Patient)' or 'Population Demographics - Social Determinant Fields (Sexual orientation/Gender identity)' setting in athenaNet.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of entries to return (default 1500, max 5000)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting point of entries; 0-indexed

genderidentityfields.description: An array of strings describing a gender identity field that can be used to describe a patient in this practice.

get.summary: Returns the list of possible search types to utilize with the /patients/search endpoint.
get.description: BETA: Returns the list of possible search types to utilize with the /patients/search endpoint.

parameters.name: practiceid
parameters.description: practiceid

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of entries to return (default 1500, max 5000)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting point of entries; 0-indexed

name.description: The name of the type of search. This will also be the value of the searchtype parameter in the /patients/search endpoint',

get.summary: Get list of change events for patient's records
get.description: Retrieve a list of events for modified patient records

parameters.name: practiceid
parameters.description: practiceid

status.description: Will return one of following statuses: ACTIVE, INACTIVE, or PARTIAL. The PARTIAL status means that not all events are subscribed to. In the event of a problem, UNKNOWN may be returned.

subscriptions.description: List of events you are subscribed to.

post.summary: Subscribe to all/specific change events for patient's records

parameters.name: practiceid
parameters.description: practiceid

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Content type of the payload

success.description: Returns if the call to manipulate subscriptions for patients was successful.

eventname.description: By default, you are subscribed to all possible events.  If you only wish to subscribe to an individual event, pass the event name with this argument.

departmentids.description: For every New/Update Subscriptions complete list of departmentids should be passed. NOTE: Without DepartmentIDs entire Context/Practice will be subscribed.

get.summary: Get list of subscribed events for changes in patient's records
get.description: Retrieves list of events applicable for patients changed

parameters.name: practiceid
parameters.description: practiceid

status.description: Will return one of following statuses: ACTIVE, INACTIVE, or PARTIAL. The PARTIAL status means that not all events are subscribed to. In the event of a problem, UNKNOWN may be returned.

subscriptions.description: List of events you are subscribed to.

delete.summary: Unsubscribe to all/specific events for changes in patient's records
delete.description: Deletes a specific event which is no longer required

parameters.name: practiceid
parameters.description: practiceid

parameters.name: eventname
parameters.description: By default, you are unsubscribed from all possible events.  If you only wish to unsubscribe from an individual event, pass the event name with this argument.

success.description: Returns if the call to manipulate subscriptions for patients was successful.

get.summary: Get list of changes in patient records
get.description: Retrieve list of changes made to the patient record Note: This endpoint may rely on specific settings to be enabled in athenaNet Production to function properly that are not required in other environments. Please see Permissioned Rollout of APIs for more information if you are experiencing issues.

parameters.name: practiceid
parameters.description: practiceid

parameters.name: departmentid
parameters.description: Department ID. Multiple departments are allowed, either comma separated or with multiple values.

parameters.name: showenterprisedetails
parameters.description: If set, will show the local patient ID, Enterprise ID, provider group ID.

parameters.name: ignorerestrictions
parameters.description: Patient information for patients with record restrictions and blocked patients will not be shown.  Setting this flag to true will show that information for those patients. No effect if the CLTH_DP_NEW_BTG_MDP_RESTRICTIONS toggle is enabled.

parameters.name: showprocessedstartdatetime
parameters.description: Show already processed changes.  This will show changes that you previously retrieved at some point after this datetime mm/dd/yyyy hh24:mi:ss (Eastern). Can be used to refetch data if there was an error, such as a timeout, and records are marked as already retrieved. This is intended to be used with showprocessedenddatetime and for a short period of time only. Also note that processed messages will eventually be deleted.

parameters.name: returnglobalid
parameters.description: Fetch the Global ID of the patients.

parameters.name: confidentialitycode
parameters.description: A comma separated list of confidentiality codes to filter patients by. If not set defaults to include all confidentiality codes. Supported codes: 'N' and 'R'. Only functions if the CLTH_DP_NEW_BTG_MDP_RESTRICTIONS toggle is enabled.

parameters.name: patientid
parameters.description: Patient ID. Multiple Patient IDs are allowed, either comma separated or with multiple values.

parameters.name: showpreviouspatientids
parameters.description: If set, will show the previous patient ID this patient was merged from.

parameters.name: showinsurance
parameters.description: If set, will show insurances for patient ID when insurances are on file. If no insurance is on file, will show an empty list. INSURANCES field is returned only when COLINS-2583_PATIENT_CHANGED_SHOWINSURANCE toggle is enabled.

parameters.name: leaveunprocessed
parameters.description: For testing purposes, do not mark records as processed.

parameters.name: showprocessedenddatetime
parameters.description: See showprocessestartdatetime.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of entries to return (default 1000, max 10000)Please note that this endpoint has a different default and max than normal.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting point of entries; 0-indexed

agriculturalworker.description: Used to identify this patient as an agricultural worker. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

agriculturalworkertype.description: For patients that are agricultural workers, identifies the type of worker. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

departmentid.description: The ID of a department that this patient is registered in.

primaryproviderid.description: The "primary" provider for this patient, if set.

status.description: The "status" of the patient, one of active, inactive, prospective, or deleted.

altfirstname.description: Alternate first name that differs from legal name.

assignedsexatbirth.description: Sex that this patient was assigned at birth.

balances.description: List of balances owed by the patient, broken down by provider (financial) group.

cleanbalance.description: Indicates whether the balance is associated with a contract, payment plan, or collections agency.

collectionsbalance.description: The outstanding amount associated with a collections agency.

contracts.description: Active credit card contracts directly linked to claims with outstanding patient balances.

availablebalance.description: The available balance on this contract.

contractclass.description: The type of contract.  For example, "ONEYEAR,"

maxamount.description: The maximum allowed amount for this contract.

departmentlist.description: Comma separated list of department IDs that belong to this group

paymentplanbalance.description: The outstanding amount associated with a payment plan.

providergroupid.description: Athena ID for this financial group.

caresummarydeliverypreference.description: The patient's preference for care summary delivery.

claimbalancedetails.description: Claim level details on patient balances.  (This is only included when SHOWBALANCEDETAILS is set.)

claimdetails.description: Information related to claims for the patient.

amount.description: The amount billed for the claim.

chargeleveldetail.description: Detailed information on charges associated with the claim.

amount.description: The billed amount for the charge.

id.description: The athenaNet ID of the charge.

procedurecode.description: The CPT code associated with this charge.

procedurecodeothermodifier.description: The modifiers for the procedure code.

procedurecodesubmitted.description: The procedure code that would be submitted as part of the claim.

servicedate.description: Date of service for the charge.

transactions.description: Detailed information on transactions associated with the charge.

amount.description: The amount associated with the transaction.

description.description: Information related to the type of transaction.  (For example, a co-pay.).

epaymentid.description: The epayment ID of the payment receipt associated with this payment transaction. Applicable only for e-payments.

id.description: The athenaNet ID of the transaction.

transfertype.description: The party responsible for the parent charge of this transaction. For example, '1' (primary), '2' (secondary), or 'p' (patient).

type.description: The type of the transaction.  For charge, payment, adjustment, etc.

cleanbalance.description: Indicates whether the balance is associated with a contract or payment plan.

departmentid.description: The ID of the department where the service was rendered.

patientbalance.description: The outstanding amount owed by the patient.

servicedate.description: The date the service was rendered.

supervisingproviderid.description: The ID of the supervising provider who rendered the service.

departmentids.description: Comma separated list of department IDs that belong to this provider group

providergroupid.description: The ID of the provider group for the claim.

confidentialitycode.description: Gives the confidentiality code for the patient. Only returned when IGNORERESTRICTIONS is set to true, or the CLTH_DP_NEW_BTG_MDP_RESTRICTIONS toggle is enabled.

consenttocall.description: The flag is used to record the consent of a patient to receive automated calls per FCC requirements. The requested legal language is 'Entry of any telephone contact number constitutes written consent to receive any automated, prerecorded, and artificial voice telephone calls initiated by the Practice. To alter or revoke this consent, visit the Patient Portal "Contact Preferences" page.'

consenttotext.description: The flag is used to record the consent of a patient to receive text messages per FCC requirements. In order for this to be true, a valid mobile phone number must be set and the practice setting "Hide SMS Opt-in option" must be set to Off.

contacthomephone.description: Emergency contact home phone.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

contactmobilephone.description: Emergency contact mobile phone.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

contactname.description: The name of the (emergency) person to contact about the patient. The contactname, contactrelationship, contacthomephone, and contactmobilephone fields are all related to the emergency contact for the patient. They are NOT related to the contractpreference_* fields.

contactpreference.description: The MU-required field for "preferred contact method". This is not used by any automated systems.

contactpreference_announcement_email.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "announcement" communications delivered via email.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For completeness, turning email off is supported via the API, but it is discouraged. When email is off, patients may not not get messages from the patient portal.

contactpreference_announcement_phone.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "announcement" communications delivered via phone.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.

contactpreference_announcement_sms.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "announcement" communications delivered via SMS.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For SMS, there is specific terms of service language that must be used when displaying this as an option to be turned on.  Turning on must be an action by the patient, not a practice user.

contactpreference_appointment_email.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "appointment" communications delivered via email.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For completeness, turning email off is supported via the API, but it is discouraged. When email is off, patients may not not get messages from the patient portal.

contactpreference_appointment_phone.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "appointment" communications delivered via phone.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.

contactpreference_appointment_sms.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "appointment" communications delivered via SMS.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For SMS, there is specific terms of service language that must be used when displaying this as an option to be turned on.  Turning on must be an action by the patient, not a practice user.

contactpreference_billing_email.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "billing" communications delivered via email.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For completeness, turning email off is supported via the API, but it is discouraged. When email is off, patients may not not get messages from the patient portal.

contactpreference_billing_phone.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "billing" communications delivered via phone.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.

contactpreference_billing_sms.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "billing" communications delivered via SMS.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For SMS, there is specific terms of service language that must be used when displaying this as an option to be turned on.  Turning on must be an action by the patient, not a practice user.

contactpreference_lab_email.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "lab" communications delivered via email.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For completeness, turning email off is supported via the API, but it is discouraged. When email is off, patients may not not get messages from the patient portal.

contactpreference_lab_phone.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "lab" communications delivered via phone.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.

contactpreference_lab_sms.description: If set, the patient has indicated a preference to get or not get "lab" communications delivered via SMS.  Note that this will not be present if the practice or patient has not set it.For SMS, there is specific terms of service language that must be used when displaying this as an option to be turned on.  Turning on must be an action by the patient, not a practice user.

contactrelationship.description: Emergency contact relationship (one of SPOUSE, PARENT, CHILD, SIBLING, FRIEND, COUSIN, GUARDIAN, OTHER)

customfields.description: Same as /patients/{patientid}/customfields call, but without the department ID. Depending on setup, and only in large practices, the custom field values may or may not be the same between departments. If this is a concern, using the /patients/{patientid}/customfields call is preferred. Only for a single patient when showcustomfields is set to true.

customfieldvalue.description: For a non-select custom field, the value.

optionid.description: For a select custom field, the selectid value (from /customfield's selectlist).

deceaseddate.description: If present, the date on which a patient died.

defaultpharmacyncpdpid.description: The NCPDP ID of the patient's preferred pharmacy.  See http://www.ncpdp.org/ for details. Note: if updating this field, please make sure to have a CLINICALORDERTYPEGROUPID field as well.

checkboxesconfigured.description: the number of checkboxes configured at the practice

insuredsignature.description: a hashref with the insured signature info

insuredsignatureeffectivedate.description: the number of checkboxes configured at the practice

patientsignature.description: a hashref with the insured signature info

privacynotice.description: a hashref with the privacynotice info

donotcallyn.description: Warning! This patient will not receive any communication from the practice if this field is set to true.

driverslicenseexpirationdate.description: The expiration date of the patient's driver's license.

driverslicensenumber.description: The number of the patient's driver's license

driverslicensestateid.description: The state of the patient's driver's license. This is in the form of a 2 letter state code.

driverslicenseurl.description: The URL to the patient's driver's license

driverslicenseyn.description: True if the patient has a driver's license uploaded

email.description: Patient's email address.  'declined' can be used to indicate just that.

emailexistsyn.description: True if email exists. False if patient declined. Null if status is unknown.

employerphone.description: The patient's employer's phone number. Normally, this is set by setting employerid. However, setting this value can be used to override this on an individual patient.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

enterpriseid.description: Athena ENTERPRISEID ID for this financial group.

ethnicitycode.description: Ethnicity of the patient, using the 2.16.840.1.113883.5.50 codeset. See http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/terminologies-v3.html Special case: use "declined" to indicate that the patient declined to answer.

ethnicitycodes.description: Ethnicities of the patient, using the 2.16.840.1.113883.5.50 codeset. See http://www.hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/terminologies-v3.html Special case: use "declined" to indicate that the patient declined to answer. Multiple values or a tab-seperated list of codes is acceptable for multiple ethnicities for input.  The first ethnicity will be considered "primary".  Note: you must update all values at once if you update any.

firstappointment.description: The first appointment for this patient, excluding cancelled or no-show appointments. (mm/dd/yyyy h24:mi)

genderidentity.description: Gender with which this patient identifies.

genderidentityother.description: If a patient does not identify with any prescribed gender identity choice, this field stores the patient-provided description of gender identity.

guarantoraddresssameaspatient.description: The address of the guarantor is the same as the patient.

guarantorphone.description: Guarantor's phone number.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

guarantorrelationshiptopatient.description: The guarantor's relationship to the patient

guardianfirstname.description: The first name of the patient's guardian.

guardianlastname.description: The last name of the patient's guardian.

guardianmiddlename.description: The middle name of the patient's guardian.

guardiansuffix.description: The suffix of the patient's guardian.

hasmobileyn.description: Set to false if a client has declined a phone number.

homeboundyn.description: If the patient is homebound, this is true.

homeless.description: Used to identify this patient as homeless. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

homelesstype.description: For patients that are homeless, provides more detail regarding the patient's homeless situation. Only settable if client has Social Determinant fields turned on.

homephone.description: The patient's home phone number.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

industrycode.description: Industry of the patient, using the US Census industry code (code system 2.16.840.1.113883.6.310).  "other" can be used as well.

insurances.description: List of active patient insurance packages. Only shown for a single patient and if SHOWINSURANCE is set.

adjusterfax.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Fax for the adjuster on this case policy.  Only available for auto insurance or worker's comp case policies.

adjusterfirstname.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - First name of the adjuster on this case policy.  Only available for auto insurance or worker's comp case policies.

adjusterlastname.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Last name of the adjuster on this case policy.  Only available for auto insurance or worker's comp case policies.

adjusterphone.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Phone number/other contact info for the adjuster on this case policy.  Only available for auto insurance or worker's comp case policies.

anotherpartyresponsibleyn.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Boolean field indicating if another party was responsible for this accident.

autoaccidentstate.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the auto accident took place. Only meaningful for auto insurance case policies.

cancelled.description: The date in which the insurance was marked cancelled.

cancelledby.description: BETA FIELD: The username of the user who cancelled this insurance in athenanet.

caseinjurydate.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Date of the injury.  Required for auto insurance, legal, and worker's comp case policies.

casepolicytypename.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - The name of this type of case policy.

ccmstatusid.description: Status ID of current CCM enrollment.

ccmstatusname.description: The name of current CCM enrollment status.

coinsurancepercent.description: The coinsurance percentage for this insurance. If you've just POSTed a new insurance you will have to wait for the auto eligbility check before this field populates.

confidentialitycode.description: Gives the confidentiality code for the patient. Only returned when CLTH_DP_NEW_BTG_MDP_RESTRICTIONS toggle is enabled.

copays.description: Details about the copays for this insurance package. If you've just POSTed a new insurance you will have to wait for the auto eligbility check before these populate.

copaytype.description: What the copay amount applies to.

coveragetype.description: Details about the coverage type for this insurance package. This information is available according to the access level from the session user.

coveragetypecode.description: Coverage type code for this insurance.

coveragetypedescription.description: Coverage type description for this insurance.

created.description: BETA FIELD: The date in which the insurance was created.

createdby.description: BETA FIELD: The username of the user who created this insurance in athenanet.

deletednote.description: BETA FIELD: The athenaNet insurance notes added while cancelling the insurance.

descriptionofinjury.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - A description of the injury.  Only available for auto insurance and worker's comp case policies.

eligibilitylastchecked.description: Date the eligibility was last checked.

eligibilitymessage.description: The message, usually from our engine, of the eligibility check.

eligibilityreason.description: The source of the current status. Athena is our eligibility engine.

eligibilitystatus.description: Current eligibility status of this insurance package.

employerid.description: The employer ID associated with the patient's insurance.

icd10codes.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - See documentation for ICD9CODES.

icd9codes.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - A list of ICD9 accepted diagnosis codes. Only available for worker's comp case policies.

injuredbodypart.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Text field for describing the injured body part.  Only available for auto insurance  and worker's comp case policies.

insuranceclaimnumber.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - The auto insurance claim number or the worker's comp claim number.

insuranceidnumber.description: The insurance policy ID number (as presented on the insurance card itself).

insurancepackageaddress1.description: Address 1 for the AthenaNet insurance Package.

insurancepackageaddress2.description: Address 2 for the AthenaNet insurance Package.

insurancepackagecity.description: City for the AthenaNet insurance Package.

insurancepackagestate.description: State of the AthenaNet insurance package

insurancepackagezip.description: Zip code of the AthenaNet insurance package

insurancepayername.description: BETA FIELD: Name of the payer specific insurance package.

insurancephone.description: The phone number for the insurance company. Note: This defaults to the insurance package phone number. If this is set, it will override it. Likewise if blanked out, it will go back to default.

insuranceplandisplayname.description: Superpackagename of the specific insurance package.

insuranceplanname.description: Name of the specific insurance package.

insurancepolicyholder.description: The full name of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholderaddress1.description: The first address line of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholderaddress2.description: The second address line of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholdercity.description: The city of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholdercountrycode.description: The country code (3 letter) of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholdercountryiso3166.description: The ISO 3166 country code of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholderdob.description: The DOB of the insurance policy holder (mm/dd/yyyy).

insurancepolicyholderfirstname.description: The first name of the insurance policy holder.  Except for self-pay, required for new policies.

insurancepolicyholderlastname.description: The last name of the insurance policy holder.  Except for self-pay, required for new policies.

insurancepolicyholdermiddlename.description: The middle name of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholdersex.description: The sex of the insurance policy holder.  Except for self-pay, required for new policies.

insurancepolicyholderssn.description: The SSN of the insurance policy holder. If set, it should be either 9 digits or masked 9 chars(* followed by digits).

insurancepolicyholderstate.description: The state of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholdersuffix.description: The suffix of the insurance policy holder.

insurancepolicyholderzip.description: The zip of the insurance policy holder.

insurancetype.description: Type of insurance. E.g., Medicare Part B, Group Policy, HMO, etc.

insuredentitytypeid.description: The ID of the entity type for this insurance.

insuredidnumber.description: The insurance policy ID number of insured.

insuredpcpnpi.description: The national provider id of the primary care physcian assicated with the insurance.

insuredreferringprovider.description: The referring provider that is associated with the insurance.

ircname.description: Insurance category / company. E.g., United Healthcare, BCBS-MA, etc.

lastupdated.description: Date on which patient record was last updated.

lastupdatedby.description: User who last updated the patient record.

packageexpirationdate.description: BETA FIELD: Expiration date of insurance package.

paymentplanid.description: BETA FIELD: The payment plan id associated with patient's insurance.

pendinginsurancepackageid.description: BETA FIELD: The insurance package id of pending insurance package.

policynumber.description: The insurance group number.  This is sometimes present on an insurance card.

relatedtoautoaccidentyn.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Boolean field indicating whether this case policy is related to an auto accident.

relatedtoemploymentyn.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Boolean field indicating whether this case policy is related to the patient's employer.

relatedtootheraccidentyn.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Boolean field indicating whether this case policy is related to another accident.  Only available for worker's comp case policies.

relationshiptoinsured.description: This patient's relationship to the policy holder (text).

relationshiptoinsuredid.description: This patient's relationship to the policy holder (as an ID). See the mapping.

repricername.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Name for the repricer.  Only available for worker's comp case policies.

repricerphone.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Phone number for the repricer.  Only available for worker's comp case policies.

sequencenumber.description: 1 = primary, 2 = secondary, 3 = tertiary, etc.  Must have a primary before a secondary and a secondary before a tertiary, etc.

slidingfeeplanid.description: If the patient is on a sliding fee plan, this is the ID of that plan.  See /slidingfeeplans.

stateofreportedinjury.description: CASE POLICY FIELD - Two-letter state abbreviation for the state this injury was reported in.  Only available for worker's comp case policies.

language6392code.description: Language of the patient, using the ISO 639.2 code. (http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php; "T" or terminology code) Special case: use "declined" to indicate that the patient declined to answer.

lastappointment.description: The last appointment for this patient (before today), excluding cancelled or no-show appointments. (mm/dd/yyyy h24:mi)

lastemail.description: The last email for this patient on file.

lastupdated.description: Date on which patient record was last updated.

lastupdatedby.description: User who last updated the patient record.

localpatientid.description: 'Given showlocalpatientid is true, comma separated local patient id will be returned, if patient id is enterprise id else given patient id will be displayed.'

maritalstatus.description: Marital Status (D=Divorced, M=Married, S=Single, U=Unknown, W=Widowed, X=Separated, P=Partner)

maritalstatusname.description: The long version of the marital status.

medicationhistoryconsentverified.description: Medication history consent status.  If a practice doesn't have RXHub or Surescripts enabled, this will be null

mobilecarrierid.description: The ID of the mobile carrier, from /mobilecarriers or the list below.

mobilephone.description: The patient's mobile phone number. On input, 'declined' can be used to indicate no number. (Alternatively, hasmobile can also be set to false. "declined" simply does this for you.)  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

nextkinname.description: The full name of the next of kin.

nextkinphone.description: The next of kin phone number.  Invalid numbers in a GET/PUT will be ignored.  Patient phone numbers and other data may change, and one phone number may be associated with multiple patients. You are responsible for taking additional steps to verify patient identity and for using this data in accordance with applicable law, including HIPAA.  Invalid numbers in a POST will be ignored, possibly resulting in an error.

nextkinrelationship.description: The next of kin relationship (one of SPOUSE, PARENT, CHILD, SIBLING, FRIEND, COUSIN, GUARDIAN, OTHER)

occupationcode.description: Occupation of the patient, using the US Census occupation code (code system 2.16.840.1.113883.6.240).  "other" can be used as well.

onlinestatementonlyyn.description: Set to true if a patient wishes to get e-statements instead of paper statements. Should only be set for patients with an email address and clients with athenaCommunicator. The language we use in the portal is, "Future billing statements will be sent to you securely via your Patient Portal account. You will receive an email notice when new statements are available." This language is not required, but it is given as a suggestion.

patientid.description: Please remember to never disclose this ID to patients since it may result in inadvertant disclosure that a patient exists in a practice already.

patientphotourl.description: The URL to the patient photo

patientphotoyn.description: True if the patient has a photo uploaded

portalaccessgiven.description: This flag is set if the patient has been given access to the portal. This may be set by the API user if a patient has been given access to the portal "by providing a preprinted brochure or flyer showing the URL where patients can access their Patient Care Summaries." The practiceinfo endpoint can provide the portal URL. While technically allowed, it would be very unusual to set this to false via the API.

portalsignatureonfile.description: This flag is set if the patient's signature is on file

portalstatus.description: Portal status details.  See /patients/{patientid}/portalstatus for details.

blockedfailedloginsyn.description: Is this patient blocked from the portal due to failed login attempts.

familyblockedfailedloginsyn.description: Is this patient's family blocked from the portal due to failed login attempts.
